column2: VERMONT DMV TEST
column4: Vermont
column6: VT

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: Sharp turn ahead.
column6: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.
column8: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column10: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.

column2: 2. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.
column6: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.
column8: you may stop to let out passengers.
column10: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.

column2: 3. Drivers should use the horn:
column4: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.
column6: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.
column8: when feeling angry or upset.
column10: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.

column2: 4. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.
column6: having them checked by a mechanic.
column8: riding the pedal lightly.

column2: 5. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
column4: Warning signs (diamond)
column6: Guide signs (horizontal rectangle)
column8: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)

column2: 6. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.
column6: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column8: all vehicles must turn left immediately.

column2: 7. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.
column6: they must turn either to the right or left.
column8: they must change lane immediately.

column2: 8. This sign means:
column4: No Passing Zone
column6: One-way street
column8: Railroad crossing

column2: 9. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column6: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column8: you are not allowed to park here.
column10: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 10. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Keeping your windows clean and clear.
column6: Replacing worn wiper blades.
column8: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.

column2: 11. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column4: closetailing.
column6: speedgating.
column8: tailgating.

column2: 12. When driving behind a motorcycle:
column4: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.
column6: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.
column8: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.
column10: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.

column2: 13. Bicyclists must:
column4: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column6: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
column8: remain near the left edge of the road.
column10: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: A four-way intersection is ahead
column6: “Y” intersection ahead
column8: The road ends ahead
column10: A road joins from the right

column2: 15. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: Whoever enters the intersection first.
column6: The car on your right.
column8: You.

column2: 16. A driver on an interstate highway must make a safe lane change when approaching a stopped vehicle with flashing ______ lights.
column4: amber
column6: blue
column8: red

column2: 17. Blind spots are:
column4: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column6: lanes reserved for U-turns.
column8: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column10: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.

column2: 18. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column8: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.

column2: 19. This road sign:
column4: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column6: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column8: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.

column2: 20. You must pull over to the edge of the road and allow an emergency vehicle to pass:
column4: regardless of your direction.
column6: only if the emergency vehicle is approaching.
column8: only if the emergency vehicle is following you.
